fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • In early editions, a review of the film Dunkirk referred to the opening scene as featuring a squaddie named Gibson (played by Aneurin Barnard) when it was in fact Tommy (played by Fionn Whitehead). It also said that the “lapping scummy froth” seen in the film as soldiers wait by the surf’s edge was caused by oil and snow; it was in fact natural sea foam (From the jaws of defeat, Nolan snatches a triumph, 18 July, page 11). • A TV review referred to the Paris Commune of 1971. That should have been the Paris Commune of 1871 (The weekend’s TV, 24 July, page 17, G2). • Our obituary of John Heard (24 July, page 29) said the actor played Genevieve Page’s son in the 1985 film The Trip to Bountiful. Heard played Ludie Watts, the son of Mrs Watts, who was actually played by Geraldine Page. • Other recently corrected articles include: Clint Dempsey’s record goal helps USA past Costa Rica into Gold Cup final Porn warps culture. I hope credit-card checks nudge adults out of the habit
